content.title: Field Types
content.content:
**Field types** are crucial for giving structure to the documents processed by the CMS.
Types define the shape of content and help ensure the safety and consistency of the entire delivery pipeline.

In Sapphire CMS, some field types can accept **parameters**.
This allows users to **enhance type safety** across the system and **simplify data input** for editors.

While users can create their own custom types by providing an implementation of the **Content Layer**, Sapphire comes with a handy set of **predefined field types**.
Let's take a look at them:

| Field Type | Parametrized | Description                                                                |
|------------|--------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| check      | no           | A simple boolean field accepting yes/no values.                            |
| group      | no           | A special field type that groups multiple fields together.                 |
| number     | no           | A field that stores numeric values only.                                   |
| reference  | yes          | A field used to reference other documents within the CMS.                  |
| rich-text  | no           | Stores large chunks of formatted text, designed for core document content. |
| tag        | yes          | Allows attaching custom tags to documents.                                 |
| text       | no           | A field for labels or short unformatted text values.                       |
